abort.already_configured: Die Greenneye Monitor Integration ist bereits konfiguriert
abort.success: Konfigurierter Energiemonitor {serial_number}. Die Sensoren, die häufig aktualisiert werden (z. B. die Leistungs-, Temperatur- und Pulsfrequenzsensoren), sind standardmäßig deaktiviert. Sie können sie über die Entitätseinstellungen aktivieren.

user.title: Choose port
user.description: Specify the port to which the monitor will send data packets. This should match the port specified in the monitor's Network settings.

data_description.aux5_type: Is Aux 5 measuring current or counting pulses?
data_description.temperature_unit: What unit of temperature is the monitor configured to use? Find this in the 'Temp Degree' section of the GEM UI. Note: this might be different from what Home Assistant is configured to use.
data_description.net_metering: Which channels in the monitor are configured for net metering? For GEM, find this in the 'Chan CT' section of the GEM UI.

pulse_counter.title: Configure pulse counter
pulse_counter.description: Specify what pulse counter {pulse_counter_number} is measuring.

data.counted_quantity: What unit is the pulse counter counting?
data.counted_quantity_per_pulse: How many of that unit does each pulse represent?

data_description.device_class: What device class should the entity representing this pulse counter be? Required for use with the energy dashboard.

data.send_packet_delay: Request packet delay for GEM API calls

data_description.send_packet_delay: Experimental. Leave it False unless a @jkeljo has told you to set it to True.

data_description.serial_number: Select the serial number of a monitor to edit its options.

data_description.number: Select a pulse counter to edit its options

data_description.time_unit: Select the time interval for reporting pulse rates.

remove_yaml.title: GreenEye Monitor no longer uses YAML configuration
remove_yaml.description:
Greeneye Monitor is now configured via the UI.

Your existing YAML configuration has been imported and is no longer necessary.

Remove the greeneye_monitor section of configuration.yaml and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.
